(2021).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7aft5","text":"Take 20-50 mg of frozen tissue and add to 2 ml tubes. Keep on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d1pab","text":"Grind down tissue using plastic micro-pestle and add methanol buffer (50% methanol, 1 mM ascorbic acid, 0.5% formic acid) at 10% w/v - i.e. for 35 mg of tissue add 350 ul methanol buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4lkbm","text":"Dilute samples with mili-Q so that absorption values fall within 0.8 - 1.0 (as previously calculated by Stintzing et al. 2003). Grützner et al. (2021) found that a 12 fold dilution performed well but this could differ.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7u30","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"64n1e","text":"Put cuvettes or 96 well plates into spectophotometer and read absorbtion at 538 nm (Stintzing et al. 2003).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fg8ko","text":"Using the formula BC = (A * DF * MW * 1000) / ( ε x L) calculate the concentration of betacyanins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5mne","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3oo17","text":"BC = betanin content (mg/L)    A = absorbance (538 nm)    DF = dilution factor    MW = molecular weight (550.47 g/mol)    L = cuvette path length    ε =   molar extinction coefficient (60, 000 L/(mool cm)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":30,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":58,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":82,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":122,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":149,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b06d9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42rvc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"al211","text":"Punch out leaf discs (as many as possible in the target area) of areas expressing betanin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f8v5g","text":"Put leaf discs in 2 ml micro-centrifuge tubes and snap freeze in liquid nitrogen then store in -80 freezer until required.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
